diseases.description: Kidney stones are hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys. They can affect the urinary tract and are often painful when passing.
symptoms: Severe pain in the side and back, below the ribs
Pain that radiates to the lower abdomen and groin
treatment: Drinking lots of water to help pass the stone
Medical procedures like shock wave lithotripsy or surgery for larger stones
preventionTips: Limit foods high in oxalate like spinach and nuts
diseases.recoveryTime: Few days to several weeks depending on the size of the stone

diseases.description: Tuberculosis is a serious infectious disease that primarily affects the lungs, caused by the bacteria Mycobacterium tuberculosis. It spreads through airborne droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes. TB can be latent or active, and timely treatment is crucial to prevent complications.
symptoms: Persistent cough lasting more than 3 weeks
Chest pain or pain with breathing or coughing
treatment: Antibiotic therapy (usually a combination of drugs taken for 6 to 9 months)
Directly observed therapy (DOT) to ensure the full course of antibiotics is completed
preventionTips: Vaccination with the Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine
Complete antibiotic treatment if infected to avoid drug-resistant TB
diseases.recoveryTime: 6 to 9 months depending on treatment adherence
diseases.costEstimate: $500-$1,500 for a full treatment course, depending on the healthcare facility

diseases.description: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It is characterized by an itchy rash with red spots and blisters, primarily affecting children but can occur in adults as well. Once infected, the virus remains dormant in the body and can reactivate later in life as shingles.
treatment: Calamine lotion for soothing the skin
Antiviral medications in severe cases (e.g., acyclovir)
preventionTips: Vaccination with the varicella vaccine (two doses recommended)
Avoid close contact with infected individuals
Good hygiene practices to prevent the spread
diseases.costEstimate: $50-$150 for over-the-counter treatments; higher for antiviral medication if prescribed

diseases.description: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder in which brain activity becomes abnormal, causing seizures or periods of unusual behavior, sensations, and sometimes loss of awareness. It can occur due to genetic factors, brain injury, or unknown causes. Proper diagnosis and treatment are essential for managing the condition.
symptoms: Uncontrollable jerking movements of the arms and legs
treatment: Lifestyle changes to avoid seizure triggers
preventionTips: Avoiding known seizure triggers such as stress, sleep deprivation, and alcohol
diseases.costEstimate: $100-$500 per month depending on treatment and medications

diseases.description: Parkinson's Disease is a progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement. It develops gradually, starting with a barely noticeable tremor in one hand, but it can lead to stiffness, slow movement, and difficulties with balance. It is caused by the loss of dopamine-producing neurons in the brain.
symptoms: Tremors (shaking) in hands, arms, legs, jaw, or head
treatment: Medications such as Levodopa and dopamine agonists
preventionTips: There is no known way to prevent Parkinson’s Disease, but maintaining a healthy diet, regular exercise, and protecting the brain from injury may help reduce the risk.
diseases.recoveryTime: Ongoing management, as Parkinson's is a chronic progressive condition
diseases.costEstimate: $200-$1000 per month depending on treatment plan

diseases.description: Goiter is an abnormal enlargement of the thyroid gland, often caused by iodine deficiency. It can result in difficulty swallowing, breathing issues, and visible swelling in the neck.
symptoms: Swelling at the base of the neck

locations: Specialized endocrinology clinics or hospitals with thyroid care units

preventionTips: Ensure adequate intake of iodine through diet
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies depending on severity and treatment method
diseases.costEstimate: $100-$500 depending on treatment type (surgery is more expensive)
